definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to be outraged by an injustice
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
where there is injustice, there will be an outcry/man will cry out against injustice
see 打抱不平[da3 bao4 bu4 ping2]

sentences.english: The Wang Shi lip Yi moved several bottoms, didn't talk, but the facial expression is aggrieved.
sentences.chinese: 王氏嘴脣翳動了幾下，沒有說話，臉色卻忿忿不平。

sentences.english: He often bullies you. I really take up the cudgel for you.
sentences.chinese: 他常欺負你，我真爲你打抱不平。

sentences.english: The Rocky Mountains have rugged mountains and roads.
sentences.chinese: 落基山脈有崇山峻嶺和崎嶇不平的道路。

sentences.english: It was an irregular, dark gap, but he could not see deep into it.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個凹凸不平的溝，但是他看不到太深的地方。

sentences.english: Specifically see the injustice all the way, good to play the powerful Han, as the city is people are afraid of him Jiangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 專一路見不平，好打強漢，以此江州滿城人都怕他。

sentences.english: All the heroes in "The Water Margin" are such valiants.
sentences.chinese: 《水滸傳》裏的英雄們都是愛“打抱不平”的好漢。

sentences.english: While driving on the bumpy section of the road, he switches on the shock-absorbers.
sentences.chinese: 在路面不平的路段他開啓了減震器。

sentences.english: Loofah body is uneven, the head also wore a yellow color of the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 絲瓜身上是凹凸不平的，頭上還頂着個黃顏色的小花。

sentences.english: The hostility between the weak and the strong, the existence of inequality in our world.
sentences.chinese: 弱者與強者的敵對，世間所存在的不平等性。

sentences.english: The economy is in the midst of a very rough patch. The worst is probably still ahead.
sentences.chinese: 經濟仍在崎嶇不平的路途中，最壞的事情還沒發生。

sentences.english: Those who climb the Western Steps experience a more rugged climb.
sentences.chinese: 而選擇攀登西面梯道，則要經受崎嶇不平的梯級。

sentences.english: Things might get a little bumpy.
sentences.chinese: 前路可能有點坎坷不平。

sentences.english: Henderson's tenure as CEO was tumultuous from the start.
sentences.chinese: 韓德勝的CEO之路從一開始就是坎坷不平的。

sentences.english: Millstones had been cut and laboriously sledged down the rough mountainsides .
sentences.chinese: 石磨被琢好，然後費力用雪橇運下那崎嶇不平的山坡。
海水將海岸衝擊得凹凸不平。

sentences.english: The other picture had mountains， too. But these were  rugged and  bare.
sentences.chinese: 另一幅畫也有山脈，但卻崎嶇不平，而且光禿禿的。

definition: variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
variant of 憤恨|愤恨[fen4 hen4]
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
